verses.verse: <S%H1945>Woe<s%> to them that <S%H2803>devise<s%> <S%H205>iniquity<s%>, and <S%H6466>work<s%> <S%H7451>evil<s%> upon their <S%H4904>beds<s%>! when the <S%H1242>morning<s%> is <S%H216>light<s%>, they <S%H6213>practise<s%> it, because it <S%H3426>is<s%> in the <S%H410>power<s%> of their <S%H3027>hand<s%>.

And they <S%H2530>covet<s%> <S%H7704>fields<s%>, and take them by <S%H1497>violence<s%>; and <S%H1004>houses<s%>, and take them <S%H5375>away<s%>: so they <S%H6231>oppress<s%> a <S%H1397>man<s%> and his <S%H1004>house<s%>, even a <S%H376>man<s%> and his <S%H5159>heritage<s%>.

Therefore thus <S%H559>saith<s%> the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>; Behold, against this <S%H4940>family<s%> do I <S%H2803>devise<s%> an <S%H7451>evil<s%>, from which ye shall not <S%H4185>remove<s%> your <S%H6677>necks<s%>; neither shall ye <S%H3212>go<s%> <S%H7317>haughtily<s%>: for this <S%H6256>time<s%> is <S%H7451>evil<s%>.

¶ In that <S%H3117>day<s%> shall one take <S%H5375>up<s%> a <S%H4912>parable<s%> against you, and <S%H5091>lament<s%> with a <S%H5093>doleful<s%> <S%H5092>lamentation<s%>, and <S%H559>say<s%>, We be <S%H7703>utterly<s%> <S%H7703>spoiled<s%>: he hath <S%H4171>changed<s%> the <S%H2506>portion<s%> of my <S%H5971>people<s%>: how hath he <S%H4185>removed<s%> it from me! turning <S%H7725>away<s%> he hath <S%H2505>divided<s%> our <S%H7704>fields<s%>.
Therefore thou shalt have none that shall <S%H7993>cast<s%> a <S%H2256>cord<s%> by <S%H1486>lot<s%> in the <S%H6951>congregation<s%> of the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>.
<S%H5197>Prophesy<s%> ye not, say they to them that <S%H5197>prophesy<s%>: they shall not <S%H5197>prophesy<s%> to them, that they shall not <S%H5253>take<s%> <S%H3639>shame<s%>.

¶ O thou that art <S%H559>named<s%> the <S%H1004>house<s%> of <S%H3290>Jacob<s%>, is the <S%H7307>spirit<s%> of the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> <S%H7114>straitened<s%>? are these his <S%H4611>doings<s%>? do not my <S%H1697>words<s%> do <S%H3190>good<s%> to him that <S%H1980>walketh<s%> <S%H3477>uprightly<s%>?

Even of <S%H865>late<s%> my <S%H5971>people<s%> is risen <S%H6965>up<s%> as an <S%H341>enemy<s%>: ye pull <S%H6584>off<s%> the <S%H145>robe<s%> <S%H4136>with<s%> the <S%H8008>garment<s%> from them that <S%H5674>pass<s%> by <S%H983>securely<s%> as men <S%H7725>averse<s%> from <S%H4421>war<s%>.

The <S%H802>women<s%> of my <S%H5971>people<s%> have ye cast <S%H1644>out<s%> from their <S%H8588>pleasant<s%> <S%H1004>houses<s%>; from their <S%H5768>children<s%> have ye taken <S%H3947>away<s%> my <S%H1926>glory<s%> for <S%H5769>ever<s%>.

<S%H6965>Arise<s%> ye, and <S%H3212>depart<s%>; for this is not your <S%H4496>rest<s%>: because it is <S%H2930>polluted<s%>, it shall <S%H2254>destroy<s%> you, even with a <S%H4834>sore<s%> <S%H2256>destruction<s%>.

<S%H3863>If<s%> a <S%H376>man<s%> <S%H1980>walking<s%> in the <S%H7307>spirit<s%> and <S%H8267>falsehood<s%> do <S%H3576>lie<s%>, saying, I will <S%H5197>prophesy<s%> unto thee of <S%H3196>wine<s%> and of strong <S%H7941>drink<s%>; he shall even be the <S%H5197>prophet<s%> of this <S%H5971>people<s%>.

¶ I will <S%H622>surely<s%> <S%H622>assemble<s%>, O <S%H3290>Jacob<s%>, all of thee; I will <S%H6908>surely<s%> <S%H6908>gather<s%> the <S%H7611>remnant<s%> of <S%H3478>Israel<s%>; I will <S%H7760>put<s%> them <S%H3162>together<s%> as the <S%H6629>sheep<s%> of <S%H1223%H1224>Bozrah<s%>, as the <S%H5739>flock<s%> in the <S%H8432>midst<s%> of their <S%H1699>fold<s%>: they shall make great <S%H1949>noise<s%> by reason of the multitude of <S%H120>men<s%>.

The <S%H6555>breaker<s%> is come <S%H5927>up<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> them: they have broken <S%H6555>up<s%>, and have passed <S%H5674>through<s%> the <S%H8179>gate<s%>, and are gone <S%H3318>out<s%> by it: and their <S%H4428>king<s%> shall <S%H5674>pass<s%> <S%H6440>before<s%> them, and the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> on the <S%H7218>head<s%> of them.
